query: I'm 16 and help care for my mother who has MS in london. This is affecting my schoolwork. Is there any support for young carers?

Request a Carer’s Assessment 
If you are an adult carer (living in the City of London), 
request a Carer’s Assessment. 
An Assessment will consider what support needs you have

After the assessment, the local authority must determine whether the person is eligible for
care and support. As part of the process, the authority must consider other things besides
services that can contribute to the desired outcomes, and whether any universal preventative
services or other services available locally could help them stay well for longer. If the needs

authority should still give you free advice about where they can get help in the local
community.

Support and information for young carers Date updated: 7/05/2025 You can call the Children and Families team on 020 7332 3621 (Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm) or 020 8356 8855/020 8356 2710 (outside normal working hours). As a young carer, its very important that you look after yourself, that way you can enjoy your childhood and provide the best care for the person/people you take care of. A lot of young carers remain private about their caring responsibilities because they feel embarrassed about it. You can feel proud to be a carer, acknowledge you are a carer and access the free services below to access support, knowledge and guidance to help you. View all Speak to your GP and school Finding the time to care for someone else and balance other aspects of your life can be challenging but doesn't have to be impossible. The better you feel the better you can care for others

They will invite the young person for a health check each year, to make sure that they are healthy.  31

answer:
As a young carer in London, there is support available to help you balance your caring responsibilities with your schoolwork. You can access emotional and practical support, individual support plans, and join carer support groups through services like Imago and City Connections.

- **Contact the Children and Families Team**: You can reach out to them for support by calling 020 7332 3621 or emailing children.duty@cityoflondon.gov.uk. They can help you with an Early Help Assessment to determine what support you might need.
  
- **Imago Support**: This service provides emotional and practical support for young carers aged 16 and over, including regular online and in-person support groups.

- **Talk to Your GP and School**: Inform your GP and school about your role as a carer. They can offer additional support, such as flexible appointments and assistance with managing your schoolwork.

For more information, you can visit the City of London's website on support for young carers: [City of London Support for Carers](https://www.cityoflondon.gov.uk/services/social-care-for-adults/support-for-carers/support-and-information-for-young-carers).
